paper_metadata.title: Quantitative evidence on the impact of social protection such as livelihood programs (LPs) on reducing vulnerability to poverty (VtP)

program_information.program_name: Odisha Tribal Empowerment and Livelihoods Program (OTELP)

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: Specifically, the program is consisted of four sets of activities: (1) to build the capacity of marginal groups; (2) to enhance the access of poor tribal people to natural resources and increase their productivity; (3) to encourage and facilitate off-farm enterprises; and (4) to ensure basic entitlements of tribal households

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: The ESR results indicate that a household's VtP is reduced by 3% for those that participate in LPs
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: We correct for observed and unobserved selection bias using the endogenous switching regression (ESR) model to obtain the average treatment effect on the treated of OTELP on VtP

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: We selected the OTELP, which specifically targeted the tribal zone of Odisha for economic development and to uplift the poor and vulnerable households
evidence_citations.country_citation: The analysis is based on the primary data collected in 2018-19 from 479 households in a tribal region of eastern India
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: We selected the OTELP, which specifically targeted the tribal zone of Odisha for economic development and to uplift the poor and vulnerable households
